comment: This was the only course where I truly gained valuable knowledge learning the Robot Operating System from the basics-expert level. Dr. Tanveer's ability to simplify concepts and promote hands-on learning inspired me to develop my own robots from scratch. What once felt like a dream has now become my passion, all thanks to his exceptional mentorship
Simply one of the best professors. Nothing else to say.

Dr. Tanveer is an exceptional mentor and advisor. He has guided us effectively and ensured that we publish our research papers successfully for 4911 and 4912 course. He understands the strengths/weaknesses of the group and makes every effort to provide the best guidance. His project management skills and lecture preparation are truly next-level.
He is enthusiastic about students' learning. His knowledge of embedded devices and Robot Operating Systems (ROS) makes this course more interesting, particularly the lab sessions.
I admire his teaching style, which includes lectures, training, and tutorials. He is very excited to teach you. He'll make sure you're well-trained in the topics he'll be covering in class.
He taught us the MTRE 1000 Lab VEX robot portion. We have a friendly communication environment in the Lab. I would highly recommend Dr. Tanveer to future students.

He is a nice Professor. I always enjoyed his class. He explains concepts with straightforward examples. He will cover all the course contents but selects which topics to concentrate on for project, assignment, quizzes and exams. He will give you extra time if you have questions.

Dr. Hassan has some serious hardware and software skills that makes his lectures super interesting. His expertise in microcontrollers and pneumatics help me to do the course project on my own. He is very helpful Professor who wants his student to learn.

Dr. Hassan is a good professor. He lectures fast, but if you try to keep up and meet with him after class or in his office, he will help you out. the micro controller content is really difficult and its really overwhelming to learn for the first time, especially at the speed he lectures at, but it is do-able.
